alert.note: Alert for Marion; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MARION AND SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lebanon, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Springfield, Loretto, Raywick, Saint Francis, Burkes Spring, Saint Joseph, Belltown, Nerinx and Bearwallow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
